noun.description: An ornamental structure in a pool or lake from which one or more jets of water are pumped into the air.

verb.description: Spurt or cascade like a fountain.
examples: an enormous curtain of lava fountained into the sky

origin: Middle English (in fountain (sense 2 of the noun)): from Old French fontaine, from late Latin fontana, feminine of Latin fontanus, adjective from fons, font- a spring.
